sessions.name: Total Station
sessions.description: The technive season is on it's full run, in its most newfangled version, Prajwalan'19 presents (Leap of Civil Engg Survey in Digital World) TOTAL STATION Workshop under the patronage of Make In India, Digital India and UNESCO.  A total station (TS) or total station theodolite (TST) is an electronic/optical instrument used for surveying and building construction. It is an electronic transit theodolite integrated with electronic distance measurement (EDM) to measure both vertical and horizontal angles and the slope distance from the instrument to a particular point, and an on-board computer to collect data and perform triangulation calculations.Here is the opportunity for you to learn about the TOTAL STATION. Grab the opportunity! Note-Partcipants will get certified.
speakerNames: Shyam Dhote, Shree Guru Consultancy, Nagpur
sessions.contact:
For more Details Contact: 
Prachi Thakur 8208521288 
Vaishnav Vaidya 7709635682 
Kiran Sakhare 8669350992

sessions.name: Augmented Reality
sessions.description: The technive season has come back, Prajwalan'19 presents two day Masterclass on Augmented Reality for the first time in Nagpur. This weekend upgrade yourself with the upcoming technology on Augmented Reality. Come and work on Unity Software and develop your own Android app. How to get started? Here is the opportunity for you to learn the basics of the software, which will help you to get acquainted with the software, this software is also used for game development. Get certified with the patronage of Digital India, Make in India and UNESCO. Grab the opportunity!
sessions.contact:
For more Details Contact: 
Prachi Thakur 8208521288 
Vaishnav Vaidya 7709635682 
Kiran Sakhare 8669350992

sessions.name: Virtual Reality
sessions.description: The technive season has came back, in its most newfangled version, PRAJWALAN'19 presents VIRTUAL REALITY Workshop under the patronage of Make In India, Digital India and UNESCO.Virtual reality is an artificial environment that is created with software and presented to the user in such a way that the user suspends belief and accepts it as a real environment. On a computer, virtual reality is primarily experienced through two of the five senses: sight and sound. Here is the opportunity for you to learn about the VIRTUAL REALITY. Grab the opportunity! NOTE- Partcipants will get certified with Digital India,Make in India,UNESCO & GCoEA collaboration. NOTE- You have to get registered before the day of Workshop.
sessions.contact:
For more Details Contact: 
Prachi Thakur 8208521288 
Kiran Sakhare 8669350992 
Vaishnav Vaidya 7709635682

sessions.name: Matlab
sessions.description: The technive season has came back, in its most newfangled version, Prajwalan'19 presents MATLAB Workshop under the patronage of Make In India and Digital India. MATLAB has wide scope and is essential for all the branches. MATLAB is used to perform virtual simulation, graphical output, complex mathematical calculations, image processing etc. But before all the advance level, how to get started? Here is the opportunity for you to learn the basics of the software, which will help you to get acquainted with the MATLAB software. Grab the opportunity!
sessions.contact:

Prachi Thakur 8208521288 
Kiran Sakhare 8669350992

speakers.name: Andromaster
speakers.desc: Are you an android expert? Participate in AndroMaster and win prizes!
speakers.about3: • Round 1 consist of Android quiz competition.
speakers.about4: • Those who qualify will move to next round while remaining will be eliminated.
speakers.about6: • Round 2 called as the Tasker round, different tasks are given related to android on android simulators, which will be installed on pc.
speakers.about7: • On the basis of time required and efficiency, participant will win the title of “Andromaster”.
speakers.rules2: • Only one member can participate in the event.
speakers.rules3: • Anyone found in unethical practice would be disqualified.
speakers.rules4: • Participants are not allowed to use their android/smart phones in competition.

speakers.name: Angry Birds
speakers.desc: Think you can hit the bull's eye? Smash the boxes and win prizes!
speakers.rules1: • Six chances per team of two members.
speakers.rules3: • Winner will be promoted to next level.
speakers.rules4: • Every level will have different target setup.
speakers.rules5: • Number of levels may change according to the number of entries.
speakers.rules6: • Playing time will be 3 minutes per team.
speakers.rules7: • Shortlisting will be done on first come basis or maximum points scored.

speakers.name: Astroquiz
speakers.desc: Test your astonomy knowledge and win the Astroquiz
speakers.about2: • The basic concept of this event is based on your astronomy knowledge. This event is open for any student. This event will improve your knowledge of astronomy.
speakers.rules2: • First round will be taken in four zones(parts). Winners of first round will qualify for second round.
speakers.rules3: • Second round will be surprise round.

speakers.name: Box Cricket
speakers.desc: Love playing gully? Love the one tip one hand out? Play Box Cricket but for prizes this time!
speakers.about3: • One tip one hand Out.
speakers.about4: • Smiley ball will be used and bats will be provided.
speakers.about5: • No free hit no No ball.
speakers.about7: • Last man will be allowed to play.
speakers.about8: • A box will be put on ground if a ball passed through that box then 6 runs will be given.
speakers.about9: • one hatrick and 3 consicative fours, extra points will be given.
speakers.about10: • Bowling style will be told on time.

speakers.name: CAD Strife
speakers.desc: Show off your designing skills with CAD softwares and win amazing prizes!
speakers.about2: • Team consist of max. 2 members and have to develop 2D Drawing using Autocad software. Only students with proper Ids are allowed
speakers.about3: CRITERIA:
speakers.about4: • First round is elimination round from which 20 participants will be selected based on drawings.
speakers.about5: • Top 2 shall be select as winner and runner up.
speakers.rules3: • Round 2:- Develop 2D plan, elevation and section with details in 45 minutes.

speakers.name: Chanakya
speakers.desc: Have a great G.K.? Want to be the new age Chanakya? Then this is the event for you.
speakers.about2: • Round 1: 30 multiple choice questions for 30 minutes.
speakers.about3: • Round 2: Double trouble Round.
speakers.about5: • Round 3: Final round which is picture perception round.
speakers.rules3: • You should come on given time only.
speakers.rules4: • In case of any misbaheviour, you will be disqualified.

speakers.name: Ciruit Mania
speakers.desc: Passionate about electronics?Play around with electronic components,build circuits and win prizes.
speakers.about3: • Group A- for diploma, 1st and 2nd year engineering students.
speakers.about4: • Group B- for 3rd and final year engineering students.
speakers.about7: • There are about 4 rounds for each group separately.
speakers.about8: • Participants will be divided into two groups (Group A and Group B) in which Group A consist of participants from diploma and engineering 1st and Group B consist of participants from engineering 2nd , 3rd and 4th year as well as PG students.
speakers.about9: • Difficulty level will be more for Group B than Group A.
speakers.about13: • The questions will be based on quantitative ability, reasoning skills and technical knowledge of electronics.
speakers.about14: • Both groups will have different apptitude tests.
speakers.about15: • The cut off marks will be decided according to the average marks scored by the participants.
speakers.about16: • More focus will be given on Technical questions.
speakers.about18: • Participants will be provided with some circuits with errors.  First five groups who answer correctly would be sent to the final round.
speakers.about19: • They need to rectify the circuits and design an error free circuit within a given time limit.
speakers.about20: • First five groups who answer correctly would be sent to the final round.
speakers.about23: • The shortlisted teams will get a circuit name.The shortlisted teams will get a chit consisting of a riddle with hint.
speakers.about24: • They need to identify the circuit from the riddle and design the circuit along with its correct output within a given time limit.
speakers.about25: • First two groups to complete the task first would be the prize winners respectively from each group.

speakers.name: Bridge Building
speakers.desc: Merge your ideas and construction skills to build a bridge tower
speakers.about2: Participants have to prepare a bridge using given materials in given duration of 1 hour, with suitable mentioned dimensions in the problem. Participants should tie sticks together by using cello tape only.
speakers.about3: RULES:
speakers.about7: • Bridge tower should be hollow from inside.
speakers.about8: • No extra fevicol or sticks will be provided.
speakers.about9: • Participants should bring their bridge in time for loading test.
speakers.about11: • The bridge tower will be tested for a) Dimesions b) Load bearing
speakers.about12: • Prepared bridge tower will be tested with axial load up to failure using an appropriate loading arrangement.
speakers.about13: • The bridge tower within the given dimension and carrying the maximum load will be declared winner of the event.
speakers.about15: • Their will be only one round. The event will start at 10:30 am till 6:00 pm. Participants can come at any hour of time to participate.

speakers.name: Encipher
speakers.desc: Grab the opportunity to show off your coding skills in Enchiper and win great prizes!
speakers.about1: Round 0: Mock Test for every participatent
speakers.about3: • Questions on core data structure and algorithm
speakers.about4: • What is the output of the given (eg. LCS,Bitonic sequence)
speakers.about9: Round 3. 3 coding questions (1 easy , 1 medium , 1 hard ) (55 min)

speakers.about3: •Participants will have to answer 25 questions using google in 10 minutes.

speakers.about38: •Final will take place between winners of previous round. This final will be of best of 5.

speakers.name: Mastermind
speakers.desc: Think you can outwit them all? Find the treasure fast and become the MasterMind.
speakers.about3: •The PC will be locked with some password, the participants will be given the clues of password and they have to
speakers.about6: •Some files or folders will be hidden at some particular location in the PC .Participants will be provided with the clues

speakers.about9: •Participants will be given some images (may be of any person or monuments or structures etc) on the PC. Firstly, they
speakers.about10: have to recognize the image and then they have to search the same image with the same dimensions on the internet.
speakers.about11: •In case, if there is a TIE between any of the participants then there will be a surprise round conducted for them.

speakers.about8: Entry fee- 60 Rs per member (minimum 3 members in a team).

speakers.name: Mystery Hunt
speakers.desc: Hurry up, Mr.Sherlock! Solve the mysteries to win prizes.
speakers.about2: •Round 1: It consists of quiz which includes general and technical questionnaires. Identify the
speakers.about3: photos of famous inventor, logo etc. Some participants will be eliminated on the basis of
speakers.about5: •Round 2: Team have to perform a particular task. Final 5 teams will be shortlisted in this

speakers.name: PPT-A
speakers.desc: Pull up your socks and gather all your research work to win exciting prizes!
speakers.about3: • Round 2: Presentation of the paper in IEEE format.
speakers.about5: • Each team can have a maximum of two members.
speakers.about7: • The theme of the paper must be based on the mentioned topics.
speakers.about8: • The paper must not exceed 12 pages.
speakers.about9: • The paper must be in IEEE format. (The paper should be essentially in a two column format; font
speakers.about10: style: Times New Roman; Font size: 12; Headings: Bold; Heading font size: 14 )
speakers.about11: • Only purely technical papers with valid reference would be considered for short-listing.
speakers.about13: • The event will consist of two rounds; firstly, the participants will have to submit their abstracts. The
speakers.about14: registration fee for this round will be Rs 50/- per team.
speakers.about15: • Based on their abstracts, team will be shortlisted for the final round. The shortlisted teams will have
speakers.about16: to register for the final round by paying Rs 250/- per team.
speakers.about17: • Teams will get 8+2 minutes for presentation followed by question answer session.
speakers.about18: Any violation of rules may result in rejection of the paper.
speakers.about19: • Under any unusual circumstances, the final decision of the organisers and judges will be binding to
speakers.about21: • Rules for the final round will be sent to the selected candidates.
speakers.about24: • Applications of machine learning in electrical, electronics and instrumentation.
speakers.about26: • Recent trends of technology in defence.
speakers.rules2: • Applications of artificial intelligence in health sector.
speakers.rules6: • Top 25 teams selected for final presentation: Rs 250/-

speakers.name: Robotics
speakers.desc: Explode into the world of humanoids and bots and compete to be the best.

speakers.name: Rubik's Cube
speakers.desc: Put on your game face and solve the cube as fast as possible.
speakers.about1: Ever thought of solving a cube in less than 15 seconds? Ever dared to attempt that one handed or blind-folded? We here offer that to you to learn and the perfect your skills.
speakers.about2: Very rare and unique opportunity for your child to participate in Rubik's cube workshop.
speakers.about3: Rubik's Cube is only gaming activity that directly helps your child to develop *6 intelligence * (Visual, Fine motor skills, logic, Recollection Memory, 3D Visualization & Space Management)
speakers.about4: We have created a special opportunity of Rubik's Cube Workshop for EVERYONE.
speakers.about6: 1. Introduction to various cubes and similar puzzles
speakers.about7: 2. Learn how to solve a 3*3*3 cube.
speakers.about9: 4. Tips and Tricks for getting faster at solving cubes.
speakers.about11: Workshop 1:The workshop is based on the development of cube solving skills of the pupil involving the 3*3*3Rubik's cube. In this session, the participant will be taught the beginner's method for solving the Rubik's cube. Further, there will be given brief introduction about speed cubing involving the CFOP method.
speakers.about12: Workshop 2: The participants will be taught how to solve a Mirror cube. Hence, the second workshop is totally based on the development of the Mirror cube solving skills of the pupil.
speakers.about14: The second session of event comprises of two different competitions:
speakers.about17: Rubik's cube competition/ speed cubing: Round 1: participant have to solve the given cube within 120 seconds. If they solve the cube in 120 seconds or lesser time then they will be qualified for the next round.
speakers.about18: Round 3: This is the final round. Participant have to solve the given cube within 60 seconds. If they solve the cube in 60 seconds or lesser time then their average time will be calculated.
speakers.about19: The participant with the lowest average time will be qualified as the winner of the Rubik's cube / speed cubing competition. The participant with the next lowest average time will be the runner-up.
speakers.about21: Round 1: participant have to solve the given cube within 300 seconds. If they solve the cube in 300 seconds or lesser time then they will be qualified for the next round
speakers.about22: Round 2: Participant have to solve the given cube within 200 seconds. If they solve the cube in 200 seconds or lesser time then they will be qualified for the next round.
speakers.about23: Round 3: Participant have to solve the given cube within 100 seconds. If they solve the cube in 100 seconds or lesser time then their average time will be calculated
speakers.about24: The participant with the lowest average time will be qualified as the winner of the Mirror cube competition The participant with the next lowest average time will be the runner-up.
speakers.rules2: No data found for this session.

speakers.name: Sci-Lab
speakers.desc: Attention Mech-Geeks! Sci-Lab is here to test your MATLAB skills.
speakers.about3: * Aptitude Test Based On MATLAB
speakers.about6: * Top 20 Teams will qualify for level 2.
speakers.about8: * Programming test consisting of two tasks.
speakers.about9: * Top 2 groups will be declared as winners.
speakers.about10: Fees:  EVENT REGISTRATION FEES: Rs. 100/- per team of 2 members

speakers.rules5: Top 15 teams will qualify for level 2
speakers.rules7: Programming test on given task Top 2 groups will be declared as winners

speakers.name: Virtual Placement
speakers.desc: Ready for the corporate world ? Participate and find out.
speakers.about1: Virtual Placement is an event which is same as actual placement stages.
speakers.about3: Round 1: Psychometric Test
speakers.about5: (i)Computer based MCQs on Aptitude and Basic Computer Knowledge

speakers.about10: A candidate need to write a story on the picture shown, narrate it and then discuss among group members(5 to 10) to make a common story
speakers.about13: Candidates will be required to carry the printed report(1st round) along with their Resume
speakers.about14: Fees: EVENT REGISTRATION FEES: Rs. 100/- per head.

speakers.name: Web-Einstein
speakers.desc: Brush up your coding skills and bring out the designer in you.
speakers.about2: Webeinstein is an event of web designing. This is an event in which participants gets an opportunity to showcase their web designing skills. This year we have focused on 360-degree approach for our event to ensure a complete success and a great participetion of participants in prajwalan 2k18.

speakers.about10: 20 simple MCQs will be given to be solved in 30 minutes.
speakers.about11: Participants are required to attempt all the questions. Qualified teams will be eligible for Round 2 (FINAL ROUND)
speakers.about14: Team will be provided with 1 PC and with resources for Designing Web Page.

speakers.about16: One hour will be provided for Designing Web Page.
